description: The Artificial Intelligence and Robotics Laboratory was established at the University of Lagos with a vision to foster cutting-edge AI and robotics research in Africa.

Our team represented Nigeria in a robot-soccer competition held in Ethiopia between 29th June – 5th July 2018 with our team emerging in 4th place. This is a yearly event and our team learned a lot. The application of such a competition has certain positive aftermath in education, and this motivated us in organizing the first of its kind ‘UNILAG Robotics & AI competition’ (12th December 2018) as a prelude to an up-scaled, nationwide Robotics & AI competition for tertiary institutions.

Workshops on robotics were organized by AIRLAB to prepare the students for the forthcoming competition. The maiden edition was held on 20th October 2018 at UNILAG. These workshops introduced participants to quick starts on robotics projects, working with microcontrollers and creating software for robotics projects amongst many other related topics. The workshop was attended by undergraduate students of UNILAG.

The maiden edition of the UNILAG robotics competition took place on the 12th of December, 2018. The competition was well attended by students, the staff of UNILAG and interest groups from the industry.
Themed 'Solvable challenges: The making of the African Smart City'. Three of our students competed in the making of African smart cities in July 2019 held in Central University Ghana.

AIRLAB collaborated with Coderina Education and the Technology Foundation to organize free training on FIRST® LEGO® League (FLL®) Robotics for (6-10) High School students and (4) UNILAG undergraduate students (mentors/coaches)
A mobile application was proposed by the Vice-Chancellor to direct new students and visitors to navigate around the campus without hassles. This app was developed by the team from AIRLAB.

Organised in partnership with IBM and SAP, the CodeTheCurve Hackathon calls young developers and innovators to use their digital skills, creativity and entrepreneurial spirit to join forces to inspire and develop digital solutions to current and future pandemia-challenges. With nearly 200 applications received from scores of countries worldwide. Our team were one of the top forty winner selected around the world.

A team of high school students trained in the lab for coding in 2019 were later trained on robotics to represent AIRol UNILAG at the 2020 FLL competition in Abuja. The competition took place in February 2020. The team came home as a winner in CORE VALUE category out of 40 teams represented in the competition.

An All-girls team of high school students trained at our lab were trained to represent AIRLAB UNILAG at the 2021 FLL competition in Abuja. Our team came 3rd best out of 132 teams, winner of the CORE VALUE category, 1st position in Robot design, and 3rd position in Robot performance.
Our team (airol) competed internationally at Greece on the 24th - 27th of June.

UNILAG CSR sponsored by FunmiAyinke Humanitarian Foundation, happened during the long vacation of schools in Lagos. There were two set of classes, one set was for 8-12 years and the other set for 13-17years.
Our Teens Robotics team (Team ConTech) took the 3rd Position at the First Tech Challenge (FTC 2022), a national robotics competition held at Baze University, Abuja.

event: Free Summer AI and Robotic Program
description: We hosted a one-month summer programme that trained participants between the ages of 8 and 16 in the basics of coding and robotics. It also exposed the young participants to software applications which they deployed in the creation of different projects.

Our Kids and Teem Arm won big at the FIRST Robotics Competition held between Monday, February 13 and Tuesday, February 14, 2023 in Lagos and Abuja. The Competition featured various challenges including First Lego League (FLL) for kids between ages 8 and 12 years and First Tech Challenge (FTC) for teenagers between ages 13 and 16 years.

The 4-day bootcamp which began on Tuesday, April 11, 2023 provided a platform for the training of 25 high school students – 15 females and 10 males – selected from over 200 applicants across Lagos state.

event: AI and Robotics Bootcamp for Ogun State Students
description: We supported the House of Rep (Hon. Adewunmi Oriyomi Onanuga) for Ogun State Constituency with the support of DaisyGo Concepts Limited, and the National Mathematical Centre in a one-week Bootcamp in Robotics for 20 students and 8 tutors from Ogun state.
Our Teens Robotics team (ConTech) comprising of 11 students and 2 coaches, achieved 1st place in the Think Award Category for best Robot design, and 3rd place in the Inspire Award Category.

event: AIRLAB x BLSC - STEM Summer Camp
description: We partnered with Blended Learning and Study Centre (BLSC) to run a two-week summer program on AI and Robotics.The program catered to participants aged 8 to 17, with a total of 79 students attending. The classes were organized into three categories: First Lego League, First Tech Challenge, and Drone Technology.

In partnership with NaijaCoder, we ran a Python programming summer camp. It was a free coding program designed for high school students in Nigeria, and hosted 42 participants who gained valuable knowledge in Python programming.

event: AI and Robotics training for Young Adults in Remo Federal Constituency, Ogun State
description: We supported the House of Rep (Hon. Adewunmi Oriyomi Onanuga) for Ogun State Constituency with the support of DaisyGo Concepts Limited, and the National Mathematical Centre in a one-week Bootcamp in Robotics for 20 students and 14 tutors from Ogun state.
We partnered with Lerobot and TNKR to organize a robotics hackathon. The focus of the hackathon was for participants to build robots capable of playing chess with humans.

Partnering with NaijaCoder, we ran a Python programming summer camp. It was a free coding program designed for high school students in Nigeria, and hosted 40 participants who gained valuable knowledge in Python programming.

We hosted a 4 week summer program on AI and Robotics. The program catered to participants aged 8 to 18, with a total of 79 students attending. The classes were organized into three categories: REV Robotics, Drone Technology and 3D Printing.
Continuously growing our team, research areas, and collaborations to tackle new challenges in AI and Robotics.
